| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1516](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1516 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A **barking spider** is a monster added in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). As the name suggests, they will make the same [noises](/wiki/Monster_sound "Monster sound") as a [dog](/wiki/Dog "Dog") when #[chatted](/wiki/Chat "Chat") with.

## Strategy

Barking spiders are generally not a threat: their attacks are not [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous"), unlike the similar [giant spider](/wiki/Giant_spider "Giant spider"), and the damage they do is quite low. They are faster than an unhasted player, but overall they are little more threatening than a [giant ant](/wiki/Giant_ant "Giant ant") or [killer bee](/wiki/Killer_bee "Killer bee").

## Origin

"Barking spider" is a common name for several related species of tarantula from Australia, deriving from the loud hissing sound they make when approached. Unlike SLASH'EM's barking spiders, they do not produce the full range of dog noises.

## Encyclopedia Entry

Eight legged creature capable of spinning webs to trap prey.  
  
"You mean you eat flies?" gasped Wilbur.  
"Certainly. Flies, bugs, grasshoppers, choice beetles,  
moths, butterflies, tasty cockroaches, gnats, midges, daddy  
longlegs, centipedes, mosquitoes, crickets - anything that is  
careless enough to get caught in my web. I have to live,  
don't I?"  
"Why, yes, of course," said Wilbur.  
\[ Charlotte's Web, by E.B. White ]
html:
Barking spider

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
s barking spider
Difficulty 7
Attacks Bite 1d2, Bite 1d2
s barking spider
Difficulty 7
Attacks

Bite 1d2, Bite 1d2

Base level 5
Base experience 59
Speed 15
Base AC 3
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 100
Nutritional value 100
Size Large
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed poison (33%)

A barking spider:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1516

A barking spider is a monster added in SLASH'EM. As the name suggests, they will make the same noises as a dog when #chatted with.

Strategy

Barking spiders are generally not a threat: their attacks are not poisonous, unlike the similar giant spider, and the damage they do is quite low. They are faster than an unhasted player, but overall they are little more threatening than a giant ant or killer bee.

Origin

"Barking spider" is a common name for several related species of tarantula from Australia, deriving from the loud hissing sound they make when approached. Unlike SLASH'EM's barking spiders, they do not produce the full range of dog noises.

Encyclopedia Entry

Eight legged creature capable of spinning webs to trap prey.

"You mean you eat flies?" gasped Wilbur.
"Certainly. Flies, bugs, grasshoppers, choice beetles,
moths, butterflies, tasty cockroaches, gnats, midges, daddy
longlegs, centipedes, mosquitoes, crickets - anything that is
careless enough to get caught in my web. I have to live,
don't I?"
"Why, yes, of course," said Wilbur.
[ Charlotte's Web, by E.B. White ]
